Here we go, Upgami, this time with Morning Musume。 23 and Sakura Oda of Morning Musume。 23's Sakura Oda.
This is a program that takes you behind the scenes of the production of various artists belonging to the Upfront Group.
We will be showing you our rehearsals, recordings, and other production processes.
Now then, let's start with a behind-the-scenes look at our two MCs.
I, FUKUMURA, performed at Japan Jam on April 30.
Project's 25th anniversary on the stage of Airi Suzuki.
Project's 25th anniversary. When I was invited to sing on stage with her, I practiced hard and worked really hard.
Yes, I was watching.
But after my stage was over, I was sweating.
And then the sweat cooled and my body stiffened.
All the way up to the time of the performance, I was moving my body to warm up my voice and vocalize.
And I thought my voice came out.
And I sang one chorus during the performance.
She said it was good.
And then the second chorus, we had to do a back-up dance, so I gave it my all.
Then I made the prescriptive mistake of coming back to the stage at the end of the interlude and not being able to sing because I ran out of energy.
That's very prescriptive.
That's right.
I gave 100% to that one song, and I wanted it to be more than 100%, and I was surprised at how much I couldn't reach the pitch.
It was very frustrating, but I am happy that I was able to give it my all.
I was also impressed by Airi Suzuki's perfect singing, dancing and facial expressions, no matter where she sang or danced or where she sang from.
I realized that I still have to work harder, so I started muscle training the next day.
That's great!
I, Sakura Oda, am so wonderful that the first outfit for the concert tour I'm doing now is a white long-skirted dress.
The first half of the concert tour we all wear white long-skirted dresses, but in the middle of the show, the skirts are designed to be taken off.
It's so long that you can step on it yourself, or someone else can step on it, or you can just stand on it and take it off, so I'm trying to come up with a new technique.
I'm currently going through a tour where I'm experimenting with nutrition and trial and error.
It's true that the tension is different from the usual tours, isn't it?
If you come to see the tour and see the members who are a little tense on their skirts, please think that they are doing their best and watch over them.
Please look at us warmly.
I'm glad you're watching us!
Now, let's start with this time's up-dated paper.

I thought again that the freshness and care of Beyoncé's new songs are also good, and I look forward to seeing how this song will change in the future.

When I first heard the song, my impression was that if the singer shifted the pitch of the modulation in the chorus even a millimeter, I could hear the chord. I thought it sounded like a very difficult song.

I call this kind of genre of music "thesaurus" or "thesaurus". Maybe it's just my way of saying it, but it has that kind of sad feeling, that kind of "class warfare" feeling, and I think the chorus is really like that.
I thought the chorus was very much like that, but if the singer doesn't sing it properly, it doesn't come across. It's like a zero or a hundred kind of song.
I felt like I was singing as if I was playing a game. But when I listened to Takeuchi-san's song and this recording, it became very clear to me,
I thought that Takeuchi-san's singing voice and the fact that he could tell that this song was good was the most important skill of his, so I thought it was really wonderful.
I thought that the way she sang the song immediately after being told to do so in this recording session was as expected of Akari Takeuchi,
The song has a really wide range of pitches from the lowest to the highest, so I think it must be very difficult,
But when I see Angulum performing it, I think it is the perfect song for the current Angulum,
I want to destroy it, or rather, I want to destroy it, and there is Angulum who can destroy it, so I think it is a wonderful song that really suits the current Angulum.
That's all for now, this is the vocal recording of Akari Takeuchi, who wants to destroy Angulum.

ANGELUM
Angelem's new album "Pick Club! NOW ON SALE
Let's take it easy today.
Mizuki Fukumura and Sakura Oda have been with us for the past few days, and now it's time to say goodbye.
We've watched various videos this time, and I, Sakura Oda, watched the recording video of Runo Yofu, who is now 15 years old, which is when she turns 6.
When we were that age, we didn't have any images like this, but now, I've seen the images of myself who thought I was good at singing in the past.
But now, when I look back at the images of myself who thought I was good at singing in the past, I am surprised to see that I couldn't sing at all, right?
I looked back at the video, and I thought I was 15 years old, so I was like, "I'm a crying adolescent boy," or "I'm 16 years old.

I thought, "I'd like to look back at the footage," and I thought, "I'm 15, so I'm a crying adolescent boy, or I'm 16, or 15 or 16, and there's probably no footage left from that period of recording, so I'd really like to see it.
I really love the system of preserving this recording footage of Upokami, and I want to look back on it, and I thought again that the other members of Hello!
I, Fukumura, was particularly impressed by Akari Takeuchi's vocal recording.
I want to destroy it.
I'll never forget the look on Shuri's face when she appeared on stage crying after hearing the cheers of the fans.
I'll never forget the look on your face when you came out crying after hearing the fans cheering for you.
I wondered how she was feeling as she was recording the song, and since I was about to graduate, I wondered how she was feeling as she was recording the song.
I was also able to think about how I would feel when I record a song since I'm about to graduate.
